PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Telford
QUALIFICATIONS
BA (Hons), Business Tourism Management – Birmingham College of Food Tourism & Creative Studies (2001 – 2003)
HNC Business Tourism Management – Birmingham College of Food Tourism & Creative Studies	(1999 – 2001)
CAREER SUMMARY
Feb 2020 to date Talisman Plastics
Position: Technical Sales Manager – Plastic Mouldings Manager
Responsible for growth in all aspects of technical plastic solutions to a variety of industries, Automotive/Aerospace/Medical being the largest segments through prospecting new clients handling enquiries right through to completion.
Account Management of existing customers within technical plastics.

PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		Telford
QUALIFICATIONS
BA (Hons), Business Tourism Management – Birmingham College of Food Tourism & Creative Studies (2001 – 2003)
HNC Business Tourism Management – Birmingham College of Food Tourism & Creative Studies	(1999 – 2001)
CAREER SUMMARY
Feb 2020 to date Talisman Plastics
Position: Technical Sales Manager – Plastic Mouldings Manager
Responsible for growth in all aspects of technical plastic solutions to a variety of industries, Automotive/Aerospace/Medical being the largest segments through prospecting new clients handling enquiries right through to completion.
Account Management of existing customers within technical plastics.
Develop Marketing strategies for expansion into new and emerging sectors e.g., Electrification Infrastructure.
Mar 2019 – Feb 2020 Borg Warner PDS
Position: Sales Manager
BW UK sales lead for all Power Drive Systems passenger vehicles and commercial.
Commercial lead on J190 project, park lock for BEV programs circa £10million.
Responsible for leading BISG program from pre-production into serial production.
Commercial lead on Power Electronic programs with Aston Martin and McLaren.
Responsible for opening into Ford and initial discussion for their 48v MHEV program ongoing.
2017 – 2019 ZF Powertrain
Position: Key Account Manager – JLR & Aston Martin
ZF Commercial lead for JLR’s Hybridisation of current and future vehicle platforms
ZF Lead in all current model PHEV sales as well as future programs.  Secured order for next gen Defender after program stalled. Value £8million in DD and an increase in volumes worth approx. £100million in serial production over 4 years.
Support for 8HP Gen 3 models, current and future programs.
Support Lead KAM on Aston Martin 8HP programs.
2014 – 2017 RP Technologies
Position: Sales Manager
Head hunted by the General Manager to take charge of the sales operations for RP Technologies a specialist in Technical Prototype Injection Moulding and Injection Mould Tool Making as well as Trade Moulding and Production Tool Making.
Working with companies such as, JLR/Aston Martin and Philips Healthcare providing support from concept to sign off.
Responsible for all aspects of RP’s sales UK as well as European.  Reporting to the general manager, delivered an increase in sales of 30%.
The role was autonomous with control over developing a strategic sales approach when previously none existed.
Integral in implementing a custom CRM system to improve the sales cycle.
Review and analyse RP’s business mix to identify new markets and diversify current spread of industries.
Responsibility for all sales management reporting monthly and annually as well as analysis on performance against targets.
Enhanced the RP brand with increased marketing activities this was instrumental in the employment of a dedicated Marketing Manager.
2009 – 2014 ProtoLabs UK Ltd
Position: Key Account Manager
ProtoLabs are known as the fastest manufacture of injection mould tools and CNC components Reporting to the sales manager of a £30M manufacturing business with a global turnover of over £100M.
Responsible for aspects of UK injection mould tool sales as well some European countries for companies such as Bosch, JLR and Lear Corp.
Responsible for growing existing business by selling Protolabs industry leading Rapid Tooling and CNC machined components.
Responsible for a team of five account managers, provide ongoing coaching, weekly team and individual meetings to ensure KPI’s were being met.
Delivered supplier status with JLR as a key prototype supplier leading to order worth of £500K.
Overall Performance – generated over £5M over three years.
FY12 – achieved 120% performance on a £800K target.
FY11 – achieved 109% performance on a £700K target.
FY10 – achieved 102% performance on a £500K target.
Based on new customers revenue from existing clients.
1998 – 2009 American Express
Position: Research & Development Project Engineer
Responsible for driving and promoting American Expresses Business Travel Solutions through mainly UK companies.  Working with over 100 SME clients to provide solutions to manage their travel programs effectively.
Major accou

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
